column2: The code can be run on a freely available platform
The code is available on a public version controlled repository, such as Github
The code can be easily installed through a repository such as CRAN, Bioconductor, PyPI, CPAN, debian packages, ...
Dependencies are clearly stated in the tutorial or in the code
A tutorial or vignette is available
Following the tutorial step by step leads to no issues/errors
The tutorial shows the method's usefulness on several (>2 = 1), 2 (0.5), 1 (0.25) or no scenarios.
The purpose and usage of functions/commands is documented
The parameters of functions/commands are documented
Does the package allow plotting of (intermediate) results?
The output of functions/commands is documented
The paper is published in a peer-reviewed journal
The paper shows the method's usefulness on several (>3 = 1), three(0.75), two (0.5), one (0.25) or no real datasets.
The paper quantifies the accuracy of the method given a simulated dataset
The paper compares the performances of the method against other published methods
